alert.note: Alert for Baraga; Gogebic; Houghton; Keweenaw; Ontonagon; Southern Houghton (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 11 at 4:20AM EST until February 12 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM EST /6 AM CST/ SATURDAY... * WHAT...Lake effect snow and blowing snow. Patchy freezing drizzle early this morning. Additional snow accumulations of 2 to 8 inches, greatest in high terrain areas from Ironwood to the Porcupine Mountains, to the north of Houghton and around Herman in Baraga County. North to northwest winds gusting to 35 to 45 mph this afternoon and evening, strongest across Keweenaw County. * WHERE...Portions of central Upper and western Upper Michigan. * WHEN...Until 7 AM EST /6 AM CST/ Saturday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Areas of blowing snow will significantly reduce visibility this afternoon and evening. The hazardous conditions will impact the morning and evening commutes. Wind chills as low as 25 below zero tonight could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling.

area.areaDesc: Baraga; Gogebic; Houghton; Keweenaw; Ontonagon; Southern Houghton
